author: chris@zamp.com
body: Notes from a call with River at Ridepanda: He pulls by paid at not created at. They essentially use cash accounting, partly because sometimes payments fail for subscriptions in Stripe, and their CS team has a process to retry, reach out, etc, eventually it becomes 'uncollectible.' After explaining the human error when investigating the CSV/Zamp Stripe integration differences, River noted a large gross sales/revenue difference but a minimal tax difference. Due to the above, he was comfortable proceeding with the Stripe integration. The understanding here is that the voided or uncollectible transactions will eventually even out across multiple filing periods. We should expect about 3750+ transactions from Stripe altogether. This was a file showing the differences from January: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Gf1C5wQqn5lc7osL6_2DDMRZ0cxeSsz9ptyC0CsJjt8/edit?gid=235900895#gid=235900895

author: chris@zamp.com
body: Here are the totals: Stripe (Zamp) Gross without tax: $458,236.30. Google Sheet Gross without tax: $472,358.76 I think the subtotal in Stripe doesn't include the discount, which was $30,650.00. Before the discount this was $503,008.76 when using the Stripe subtotal. Stripe (Zamp) Gross with tax: $500,281.17 Google Sheet Gross with tax: $515,437.20 Stripe (Zamp) total tax: $42,044.87 Google Sheet total tax: $43,195.79 Note: The transactions that failed to import have totals of: Total $4,408.38 Tax: $362.38 This likely affects the difference. Voided transactions: Total: -$31,921.83 Total w/o tax: -$29,396.00 Tax: -$2,525.83 Snoozing this until the call with River to discuss the above.

author: chris@zamp.com
body: Snoozing this to re-open on Thursday and investigate more with Nick.

author: chris@zamp.com
body: You're welcome, River! OK, great; that works for us. I'll include another person from the Zamp side who helped investigate this.

author: river@ridepanda.com
body: Thanks Chris, Our team is at an offsite this week but I've scheduled with you for next Wednesday. River

author: chris@zamp.com
body: Hi River, I'm following up before we head into the weekend! Would you have time next week to discuss the differences, the logic of our Stripe integration, and the path forward? We can use this link to schedule a call: https://calendly.com/chris-zamp/30min . We found that the original total difference was incorrect due to a slight human/formula error. Additionally, I've confirmed that our Stripe integration is currently designed to import all invoices from Stripe regardless of the payment status; this aligns with Zamp's design to follow accrual-based accounting practices (instead of cash-based.) Our integration has logic in place to handle voided transactions and uncollectible transactions. We also do not import draft invoices.

author: chris@zamp.com
body: You're welcome, River! I should have a more thorough update for you tomorrow morning!

author: chris@zamp.com
body: The relevant Stripe code is here: For invoices: https://github.com/zamptax/zamp/blob/main/domains/integration/src/stripe/invoices.ts Transform handling void and uncollectible invoice statuses: https://github.com/zamptax/zamp/blob/main/domains/integration/src/stripe/transform.ts Need to follow up with River and setup a call

author: nkondak@zamp.com
body: So after looking into this: I believe the issue in difference is from using the auto sum function on excel and using different methods to find a subtotal and then total, it is giving different results. The results below are from using the total column sum by clicking on the header. Google sheet total (515,437.20) - Zamp total (515,272.81) = 164.39 (This is not accounting for discount in subtotal) Google Sheet tax   (43,195.79)    - Zamp tax.   (43,171.05) = 24.74 ( Zamp tax is different now since we are not using the stripe intergration now) In regards to the different amount of transactions with the automation, Zamp is importing 502 additional transactions. Most of them are a transaction and then supplemental voided transactions. There are 59 unaccounted-for transactions that I suspect are listed as a " Failed or Not-paid" status . River was filtering those out before posting them to the Google Sheet. I feel a call with the customer is needed to further understand any other filtering done and to see if they can set up their Stripe integration to Accrual instead of Cash based. CC @chris

author: chris@zamp.com
body: Hi Kirsten, You're welcome! I've investigated the Faire integration situation further, and the setup must be done with Katie's Faire credentials. Looking over past emails, I could not find a confirmation that this was completed; it may have gotten lost in the various changes. Here are the steps to connect Faire with Zamp: You can log in to your Zamp portal using this link . Once you are in your account, click ' Integrations ' at the top of the page. Click the ' Connect to Faire ' button to the right of the row with the Faire icon. Log into Faire through the modal that opens. Add the API key when prompted: ckfdvoqv82r4ukvb7kiak2d4334gxiwuabcaq1nzk8y38wns4da3x198sin13qv0ngvkf1pqyacz65wnn6szh246p9l31x1sxcp4 Please let us know if you have any questions and once Faire has been connected to Zamp. We're also more than happy to schedule a call to review this if you prefer.

It's possible that this fell through the cracks when switching points of contact or that the Faire integration could not import data correctly for some reason. We'll update you this week as soon as we know more!

Another quick Q: Final Switchback also sells on Etsy and Faire. I thought that Faire was set up back in December to start Jan 1st, but looking now I see this (below). I wonder if the switching of points of contacts led this to fall through the cracks. Is this something Katie needs to do with her Fair login credentials? Kirsten Barrie Founder/Owner Verte Consulting High-touch CFO & Accounting Services For Your Agency, Startup, or Scale-up

author: chris@zamp.com
body: Hi Kristen, Thanks for the question! Yes, the state of Washington assigned Final Switchback a quarterly filing frequency. Zamp will file its first return for Q1 2025 in April 2025. Thanks for the update about the site's go-live date being today! Regarding transaction removal: Our engineering team confirmed that they've removed all the test transactions noted in my previous request. I'll review the account on Monday and ask to remove any additional test transactions if I find any; I'll confirm those with you all, just to be careful. :) Have a great weekend!

author: info@verteconsulting.com
body: Also quickly, the site is live now - so any sales from today forward are valid.

author: chris@zamp.com
body: Hi Kirsten and Katie, Thanks for your patience here. We have requested that these transactions be removed, and our engineering team will take care of them. We'll follow up immediately as soon as we hear that this has been completed. Because of how our Shopify integration is designed, there's a slight chance these transactions could be re-imported if they are changed in the future. That said, we are working towards solutions to prevent this in the future. Due to the above, we will also review the Final Switchback LLC Zamp account to ensure the test transactions are not present before the WA Q1 2025 filing is processed in April 2025. Please let us know if you have any questions. I hope that everyone has a great evening!
